title: [Feature request] Re-introduce host option in mlflow ui
body:
### System information
- **Have I written custom code (as opposed to using a stock example script provided in MLflow)**:no
- **OS Platform and Distribution (e.g., Linux Ubuntu 16.04)**: Cloudera Data Science Workbench with Linux Ubuntu 16.04
- **MLflow installed from (source or binary)**: `pip3 install mlflow`
- **MLflow version (run ``mlflow --version``)**: `1.1.0`
- **Python version**:  `3.6.1`
- **npm version (if running the dev UI): not using npm
- **Exact command to reproduce**: `mlflow ui -p 8080`

### Describe the problem
mlflow version 1.0.0 removed `--host` argument (PR #1267). The reasoning was that mlflow ui was intended only for simple local use-cases and that for anything else one should use mlflow server. That's understood, however in my environment (Cloudera Data Science Workbench) the simple use-case still requires to change host name, otherwise I cannot get to see the UI (that would be running on a different host than the browser I access the "workbench" from). 

I'm trying to use mlflow in a very simple way just to track metrics saved in a local directory (or sqllite db), I don't want to spin up a server for that unnecessarily. In order to access mlflow ui running on a CDSW I need to open http server at port `8080` (cf. [Cloudera documentation](https://www.cloudera.com/documentation/data-science-workbench/latest/topics/cdsw_web_ui.html)) however with host set to `0.0.0.0` . The latter is [hard-coded](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/blob/3861af2c148a4259be969af12211aeb0e8815659/mlflow/cli.py#L198) to 127.0.0.1 in `cli.py` since PR #1267. Altering the hard-code to `0.0.0.0` made me see the UI. 

Could we re-introduce the option of setting up host also with mlflow ui, please? There are "simple" (sort of local) use-cases that would still benefit from it.
